33325614.review: I've played quite a few Atelier games over the years and I'm always surprised by how much pure charm is packed in these games. There's never huge challenges, even on harder difficulties, no awe inspiring CG work or graphics. Just a simple story played out through a free flowing narrative, and that's all it ever needs to be. Cute characters, objective based gameplay that rewards exploration and experimentation (but doesn't demand it), and a relaxed tone as you immerse yourself in the simple pleasures of finding new things to make, new materials, and new cute events. Love this series because it always knows what it is, and just adds to the experience with each new game.

33084814.review:
I have always been an Atelier fan ever since their "rebirth" to a more light hearted game in the arland series. I have played all trilogies of the Arland and Ayesha and Escha and Logy in the Dusk series. So it is safe to say that I have quite abit of experienced, if I do say so myself.

This review is for the fans who never knew what the atelier series is about


Atelier Sophie is the first entry to the Mysterious series and is the first to be ported to the PC. Ever since the Arland trilogy, the atelier series has been fairly lighthearted  with their storylines (no more saving the world kind of thing, and even if it did it was always in a more "subtle" manner) Atelier Sophie is no different, in fact it can't even be more lighthearted even if it tries too. You are an Alchemist in a small town of Kirchen Bell and the direction of the stories always stayed simple and never tried to do something grandiose. Which is totally fine for me. Though, this could be a turn off to you people who wanted a more "serious" storyline. 


The gameplay is where the Atelier series really shows its charm. To be precise, the alchemic system. The system can be daunting for new timer who have no idea what to do, but it is very easy to study and can be VERY rewarding. Most of the enjoyment of this game is derived from this system alone. The combat is fun but it isn't the mainpiece of the game. It isn't forgettable but it really isnt nothing special. 


So, what do I think of Atelier Sophie?

I think it's a great game, it never tried to be anything it wasnt and it stick to it fundamental core from beginning to end, it plays it's strength. By the end of it, it leaves you this warm and fluffy feeling and that for me, is what an Atelier game is all about.

33000739.review:
[h1]Finally[/h1]

Atelier is finally on Steam, YAY! This is my second favorite jRPG after Final fantasy and i have waited very long for this to come to PC. I feel like a baby who got an awesome present on Christmas. Yes that's how happy am i to play this on PC. It would be nice if previous Atelier games would come to PC, but i'm not too optimistic about this.

This game is about alchemy. The story is nothing like most of the games, it's not about saving the world, it has a nice lighthearted story. You play as Sophie who own an Atelier. A flying book named Plachta appears and it seems she has lost her memory and you must think of new recipes and write it in the book to help her remember who she is. Your job is to mix various ingredients in the cauldron and make cool items. You get requests from your friends and townspeople and you must venture outside to gather ingredients for alchemy to fulfill these requests. Alchemy is the key, it's only putting the ingredients into a cauldron it's much more. Various ingredients have different traits, by combining ingredients the outcome can be different every time and crafted item can have different traits. Other than doing alchemy you'll be talking to your friends, fulfilling their request and increasing friendship levels. After some time you see each character's event.

Combat is pretty simple and easy to understand, i love it. I don't like when the combat is too complicated. This game has a turn based combat, you choose your actions (attack, skill, use item, run, defend) and your stance (offense/defense) click ok and watch the animations. For being stronger in battles you'll need to craft some items, better bombs, better healing item and so on. In short, everything you use you make yourself or make ingredients, give them to other characters and they craft the weapons or armor for you. What monsters and ingredients appear in the zone depends from the time of day and week. You can get different items or encounter tougher monster at night.

Voice acting is pretty good for such a game, i can't say anything bad about it. Music is awesome as always, it creates that good atmosphere, which makes you happier.

Graphics are nothing special, same as on PS3, but that's not a downside to such game. Performance is great, 0 problems. Port is well done.

If you love jRPG's, funny dialogues and situations, deep crafting system, good story, lovable characters, fulfilling requests and exploring - don't think just buy it and support the developers so that we could get more Atelier games.


[b]Pros[/b]

Deep and well thought crafting system
Nice story
Relaxing gameplay and music
Nice graphics

[b]Cons[/b]

Haha nope

32895980.review:
说起历史最久远的年货游戏系列，不是2k公司的《NBA2k》系列，不是EA旗下的《年货召唤系列》，也不是育碧的《刺客信条》系列，而是《炼金工房系列》。这个系列始于1997年，然后几乎是以每年一部的节奏发售，目前为止已经发售了19部正统作品。虽然其开发商GUST现已并入光荣特库摩，其系列仍然保持着每年一作的年货频率，可谓当之无愧的最资深年货系列。

《苏菲的炼金工房~不可思议书的炼金术士》（简称A17）是《炼金工房》系列第17部作品，登陆ps3、ps4、psv、pc平台。主机版本繁体中文独占，其中PC版只有英文版本。令玩家诟病的是，pc在某个版本更新后，以往的中文补丁都将不可用。所以玩家在挑选版本的时候，请优先考虑主机版本。

[h1]村姑遇上会说话的炼金书——不拯救世界的rpg[/h1]
本作是一个新的世界观，即不可思议的世界。和以往系列不同的是，本作摒弃了一贯的时间限制，就算玩家躺床上几百年不推主线，也不会因为时间关系进入Bad end，所以本作的游戏氛围便变得十分轻松愉快。游戏剧情也是同样的轻松愉快，没有拯救世界，没有打败魔王，只有元气满满的女主苏菲的炼金成长历程。

女主苏菲原本是一位普通傻白甜村姑，她继承了身为炼金士的奶奶的炼金釜，开始了她的炼金生涯。在一次的炼金失败的偶然，苏菲发现写入炼金配方的炼金书居然能够开口说话，炼金书普拉芙妲坦白它失去了所有的记忆。苏菲逐渐发现，她每一次往炼金书里写入配方，普拉芙妲就能够恢复记忆，从此，苏菲就下定决心帮助它恢复所有的记忆。在帮助书恢复记忆的过程中，苏菲的炼金技巧逐渐成长，也和一些帮助她的朋友立下了不可分割的羁绊。

故事里面的角色设计十分到位，村姑苏菲的天真而又带点腹黑，炼金书普拉芙妲虽然看起来严肃但是各种傲娇卖萌，胖子奥斯卡对于植物的热爱已经到了病态……玩家基本可以像看日常番一样轻松，不过喜欢跌宕起伏剧情的玩家就要失望了，可能会感到非常无聊。

[h1]令人着迷而又疯狂的炼金系统[/h1]
炼金炼金，游戏主要玩法就是炼金术。从第一代开始，GUST就一直改进炼金玩法。经过近20年的沉淀，GUST对炼金系统核心内容的把握已经了然于心。A17的炼金系统相对于以往系列已经大幅简化，但是保留了很多趣味性，稍不注意玩家就会沉迷其中，而忘记推进剧情。

炼金过程的第一步，便是四处寻找采集素材，就算是同样的素材，也会因时间、地点的不同而带有不同的特性、品质。稀有的素材，更是需要从咖啡店老板打听传闻才可以知道什么时候，什么地点出现。这些素材是炼金的基础，决定着炼金成品的特性与品质。当玩家满足配方书中“灵光一现”的条件时，苏菲可以想出新的配方，从而创造出新的道具。由于没有时间限制，采集过程也是休闲无比，轻松愉快而又充满吸引力。

炼金过程的重头戏，就是把素材丢进调和锅里面调和了。然而调和过程并不是简单地把素材丢进锅里等待成品就好了，本作调和方式为拼图调和，由玩家使用的锅来决定锅里面的加成方式，然后再由玩家把特定形状的素材放上锅里的格子中。其中，素材所覆盖的光点越大，特性加成也就越高，覆盖同颜色的光点还会有额外的加成奖励。当特性条突破临界点时，便可以升级为新的特性；此外，素材本身的特性也能叠加（譬如重击*重击=重击+；重击+*重击+=自信一击；自信一击*重击+=一击必杀）。所以，道具的效能完全由玩家所决定，玩家异或合成高数值、高能力的极限道具，或者多样特性的通用道具。

[h1]我苏菲一炸弹下去，你可能会死[/h1]
虽然是不拯救世界rpg，我们的傻白甜苏菲小村姑不会去为了救什么国王而去和魔王战斗，但是在采集过程中，魔物会来干扰她，这样一来，为了采集安全，战斗是不可避免的了。游戏战斗玩法为经典回合制战斗，不同的是，游戏控制方式为预输入战斗指令，此外，因为主角苏菲战斗能力弱鸡，炸弹之类的道具的使用几乎成了必用品，所以游戏成了道具流玩法，所以玩家在工房造出强力的炸弹之后，就可以在魔物面前横着走了。

不过游戏到了后期战斗就略显失衡了，技能伤害极其鸡肋，玩家释放一个技能的伤害还不如普通平A一下的伤害。所以到了后期，玩家只要合成出了强力的装备，就基本都是全员平A了，甚至影响到了游戏本身推崇的道具流。难度的把控也是让人大跌眼镜，后期的强敌经常不按顺序采取行动，导致游戏战斗成了看脸和拼伤害。

[h1]精美的人设，简陋的画面[/h1]
有人说《炼金工房》系列就是买人设送游戏，这句话不是没有道理的。相比于《海王星》那看腻了的つなこ老师的画风，本作的人设是清新脱俗的。它首次采用了双画师，即不同的人设出自不同的画师之手，虽然有那么一丁点不统一，但是人设质量是非常高的，水墨画风的加持下，无一不很养眼。

游戏的人物建模也是很精细的，对于原画的还原度很高。但是相比之下，场景的画面就很简陋了，从贴图到建模，都能看出制作组对于场景的不用心。人物动作方面，非常僵硬，人物各种转身平移，肢体语言也是相当的重复。

优点：
+优秀的人设
+轻松日常的剧情
+有深度的炼金玩法
+全语音和欢快的音乐

缺点：
-前后期失衡的战斗
-糟糕的场景画面和动作

总结：音乐和配音方面没有特别点明，但是做得确实不错。游戏成就非常简单，轻松就能白金。非常适合喜爱《炼金工房》系列的玩家和喜爱轻松愉快氛围的玩家，本作十分适合入坑，新人可以考虑。
图文版：[url=http://www.gimmgimm.com/article/info?id=12204]A17-不可思议书的序幕[/url]

PS4本体を１ヶ月で売ってしまったのですが、その時やったソフィーのアトリエが面白かったのでサマーセールのタイミングでPC版を購入しました。

字幕は英語ですが音声は日本語なのでストーリーは問題なく理解できるはずです。
NPCとの会話の際に和訳が必要になる場合もありますが、まぁ英語の勉強がてら電子辞書右手にプレイしてみるのも良いのではないですかね(適当)。
錬金術でのクラフトの際にいろんな効果などが英語で書かれますが、他の方が書かれているとおり自動翻訳では訳にずれが出ます。ですが、ネット上には英語と日本語の対応表をまとめてくれているサイトもあるので、スマホ片手にプレイすればその点もクリアできるはずです。

ゲームの内容に関してもかなり良いと思います。
ストーリーもテキトーな感じではなく、BGMもなかなかアツい曲が揃っています。
登場キャラクターも個性豊かで、3Dモデルも可愛いしかっこいいです。
錬金術パズルも意外と効果のブーストを狙ったりうまくマスにハマる形の素材と選んだりとウンウン悩みながらできるので、単純なようでかなり楽しめます。


steamなら定価でも安い方ですし、セールなら間違いなく買いです。
悩んでるなら買いましょう。今は自動翻訳も自然になりましたし、英語なんてそんなに大きな壁ではないです。多分。
ゲームしながら英語の勉強ができるなんて最高じゃね？(TOEIC300点前半並発言)

あと、想像してたより英語音声の声が可愛かったです。

32840804.review:
This game is actually pretty wholesome. There is minimal outrageous anime trope/meta/fanservice/other bullcrap here. There's a generous amount of scenes between characters, and it gives them a lot of depth. It's a pretty solid installment in the series, a pretty decent Atelier game basically.

Though it's refreshing to be able to play a polished console JRPG on PC, the porting is not perfect. There are briefly some control jitters, and you might need to do a bit of work to get the thing started in the first place (C++ redistributables anyone?)

So yeah, pretty decent. I haven't yet seen anything horrifying after ~40 hours, so I think it's safe to say it's a nice game.

32830734.review: The game as a whole is pretty average for example the jrpg combat, animations, voice acting, and typical anime happy-go-lucky story fall into this category.  On the other hand the routine of "Accept Quest" - > "Explore" - > "Craft" - which you will be doing for the majority of the game - is really well paced.  This game is super addictive and relaxing to play thanks to this routine.  Little story bits are placed throughout the game and there's a decent amount of gameplay varirty.  So I would absolutely recommend this if you want to relax and like jrpg's or crafting.

32828110.review:
Great game, a lot of fun. Alchemy itself is a fun intricate puzzle mini-game with a lot of depth. The story is not a literary height, but its a nice feel-good story. The game also has a nice habbit of introducing new mechanics even quite a bit into the game, with great pacing. Giving you new mechanics at a welcome moment. Music is quite good as well.

My biggest gripe is with the combat. You don't get to see the strength of enemies untill you are already in combat with them and the game has a tendency to have a huge range of mob power in the same area. You can go from beating packs with a single hit and barely getting xp, to getting absolutely demolished by the next pack in the very same area. Can be a bit frustrating but the penalty for losing isn't very severe, you lose some of your gathered materials.

I'd happily recommend this game. Runs well, works well with a controller.

32675319.review:
Are you ready for a stream of consciousness review at 6:00AM in the morning? Great! Let's get into it.

What is Atelier Sophie?

Atelier Sophie is a game about alchemy - but not just that, the effects a single person can have on numerous others through good intentions and hard work. 

You see, Alchemy is the art of fulfilling the wishes and desires of materials to become usable items. It is listening and figuring out exactly which item works with which other, which trait will work best for which situation, and which things fit together harmoniously. 

Your job in this game is to create harmony between items, people, and situations. And the main character, Sophie Neuenmuller, is a perfect example of this quality. She is bubbly, upbeat, but flawed. She is earnest though, and nearly always owns up to her mistakes and failures, letting her good nature guide her through each and every situation.

There is a lot as people that we can take from her. Though Sophie is simply an alchemist, she shows the importance of how just one job, one role, one chance, one opportunity, filled with good natured intent - done to your fullest - can help the other people around you, lift you up, and bring happiness and joy to the places you least expect it. 

This is a coming of age story - a girl becoming a woman. Learning the human condition through the only thing she knows well - Alchemy. But enough of my ranting, lets get into a more objective break down.

Story - 5/5

The story in this game can likely be explained in just one sentence. 

"You are an alchemist, and you make items to better the town you live in."

And Gust could have just left the story there, but it didn't. While you won't find yourself drawn into Atelier Sophie's story like say, the Witcher 3 (haha), you will be drawn in by the charm and the vibrance of the characters. I've already spoken on Sophie, but her companions are just as fun, and each shows enough character and story line to avoid archetypes that plague this sort of game all the time. 

As an Alchemist in the town of Kirchen Bell, you feel like a daughter of the town. You know everyone, and everyone knows you. You gradually help them to see you grow up, grow out, and gain confidence. 

Childhood friends -feel- like childhood friends. The local market -feels- like the place to go for basic items. The lounge -feels- like a small hole in the wall - but one with charm. The town of Kirchen Bell is alive and well, and you certainely feel (even isolated up in the Atelier doing Alchemy) that you are an active part of the community.

And helping people in Kirchen Bell expounds outwards. By helping them, you help yourself, and you go on action filled romps through dungeons, which are simple in design but fun to visit again and again. Why? Because they offer new materials and new chances to test out your plethora of items. (You can hold 5,000 back at home!)

The story is light, fun, and never feels forced. It has emotion, but isn't heavy handed. It has depth, but only if you go searching. It's as cute and as fun as you'd like it to be, with as much depth as you'd like to assign to it.

It's your story, my story. We are Sophie.

Graphics - 4/5

I'm an Ultrawide Nerd, so obviously a lack of native (or hacked) support stinks. But I'm also a resilient little princess, so I'll survive. The game runs up to 2560x1440p, and if you can reach that, it looks amazing. The artwork is spectacularly drawn. The animations and areas look -justlikeanimeomg-, which is a big plus for me. 

Sure, some areas are small and kinda plain, but their vividness still pops out here and there. Atelier Sophie gets the job done in the graphics department, giving the world a Storybook feel. No one is expecting anything amazing, though 4k would have been nice to see, and UW support would have been a blessing from the PC Gods. But Gust is working on those things, and I trust them. 

I rarely encountered bugs or anything like that.

Controls - 5/5

The controls in this game are simple, and they are already mapped for you. They are explicit and easy to learn, and you won't have any mystery with this one. The easiest 5/5 I've ever given.

Gameplay - 6/5

I cheated and gave an extra point. Sorry! The Gameplay is what really makes this macaroni cook. I'll start off with Alchemy. As someone who thought this game would just be about boring crafting all day - BOY WAS I WRONG. It's about super exciting crafting mixed with neato turn based combat and cute designs!

The crafting in this game is the main selling point. It is fun, easy to learn, and feels a bit like playing a game of Tetris in a Cauldron. It's a game within a game! Sometimes I spent 2 or 3 hours just fiddling with traits and things in the Cauldron, trying to get my Alchemy just right cuz, omg, I wanted to be the best like no one ever was. To make Honey was my real test, and to not get failure ash was my cause. 

I hate crafting normally, but this game made me a fan. Instead of bein a crotchety hag about it, I really enjoyed shifting and mixing and matching colors, qualities and values. To all you hack and slash players, trust me, this is a fun little diversion that will change the way you look at crafting and sitting at a cauldron. It's a major part of the game that feels like a fun mini game every single time.

Combat

Combat is amazing. Amazing why? Because it doesn't try to be more than what it is. It's turn based fighting, with two stances- Offensive and Defensive. Sound simple? It is! 

But another element is brought in with chains, combos, and different party formations. Explosive bombs crafted in the Atelier cause devastation and make the game a demolition test on cute little critters. It's engaging and fun even during grinding. Grinding itself is never tiring, never boring, and never is at a lack for excitement based on which items and party makeups you use. 

The animations feel like a shonen anime, and it really gives you a great feeling about fighting. That's a big plus for a primarily crafting based game.

Quests/Running Around

The Quests in this game usually require you to make something or finding something, which is standard fare. Once again though, this is never boring or lacking for intrigue. Sometimes you are rewarded with really pretty cutscenes, cute dialogue, and silly interactions. Other times its just cold hard cash, which is fine too. It doesn't take you long to figure out how to get the money money money, and soon Sophie is a whale at the Bellagio. Even when you have money though, trust me, you'll be spending it on constant improvements and new gear, and each time you create something (you craft weapons and armor too, through your buddies) you have a sense of pride. 

That's what this game gives you - a sense of accomplishment. What gamer doesn't want that?

Sound - 5/5

The sound in this game is amazing. With the DLC, you can even change all the sounds to your liking (From all the older Atelier games!) With that said, the default tracks are great. They aren't overbearing, but if you take time to listen and just sit back, they are soothing when they need to be, and up beat when they need to be as well. Combat tracks never get repetitive or bland, and boss fights feel epic in all their epicness. 

You can feel Sophie getting stronger as the fights scale up, and dramatic points of the story have the proper sound for the event they are placed in. 

It's not some riveting orchestral masterpiece, but it is incredibly pleasing and cute. That,and no sound is out of place or awkward. 

Conclusion

Atelier Sophie was my first Atelier game. I'm no crafter, I'm a person that loves mashing buttons and cutting things to pieces while eating eggs whites and drinking cranberry juice. But guess what? I ate my eggs whites alot slower and drank my cranberry juice alot more delicately after this game. Engrossing, enriching and cute, this game is highly recommended and a must have for your Steam Library. 

Don't miss out!

32309318.review:
Ok so out of all of the latest Atelier games this one plays with the most freedom of all of them.  No weekly deadlines.  Freedom to explore when and where you want with a seamlessly inserted storyline.  To top it off the storyline in this Atelier game is one of the best since Iris.  One of the most fun things I found in this game was actually the ability to use songs from some of the older atelier games as music and most of the music selections in the game are changeable (you can do this from the book in the atelier).  I found that "That Kid's Shop Is Successful?" from atelier Iris 2 was very well suited to the main character and thus have it as my Atelier theme now.

Only Two negatives I encountered first being my directinput(very old tech) controller was not well implemented (not expected to be even working to be honest tho so no shame there(bit of an update here my directinput controller stopped working for the game and I would reccomend getting an xinput controller if you want to play it effectively.  although the keyboard controls are not too bad, I certainly found it worth the money to get one)) and the required installation of the 32 bit Runtime libraries on a 64 bit computer were kinda missleading.  

(the launcher is 32 bit the game shell itself is 64 bit and these are forced into those modes meaning you need both the x64 and x86 vc packages included in the redistributable folder installed.)


All negatives aside If you don't have this GET IT.  I can't reccomend this game enough.

游戏是好游戏，到我这个阶段（大概20%的流程？）为了一个优质素材翻山越岭翻箱倒柜，可能以后会更多这样的状态
战斗系统很帅，但看多了也会疲劳，怪可以躲过，但是如果一味逃避，就会打不过任务怪，很吃瘪
很轻松，很百合，很搞笑，很喜欢那个用拳套的萝莉（忘了叫什么），炼金术用太多会变矮什么的23333，大概女生会很喜欢这个游戏...大概
剧情太平淡了，完全不好奇未来会发生什么，可能有些好奇小黄书的身世，也是我没动力推游戏的一个原因
同时，剧情想要推进需要获得特定的物品或者打成特定的条件，隔着两排炼金产品很难知道那个东西怎么炼出，同时，这也让强行推进主线不太可能，只能每天做着摸鱼一样的日常，然后期待获得特定的物品。（同时还打不过怪
任务提示有些比较模糊，让人不知道怎么搞，同时也加大了强行推进主线的难度
这游戏还没有云存档，现在处于纠结删不删游戏的状态。
原价买的，轻度后悔，但这游戏还是推荐的。

31890856.review:
Como un gran seguidor de la saga Atelier desde Playstation 2, continuando con todos los juegos de Playstation 3 y actualmente (y honestamente muy agradecido, pues no poseo una PS4) los nuevos juegos que son para Steam.
Lo primero que he de decir es gracias por la entrega a pc, que llevo esperando desde hace ya un buen tiempo, dicho eso empezaré con mi análisis de Atelier Sophie, el 17° juego de la saga.

Empezando con lo bueno, tiene mecánicas algo diferentes (pero muy emocionantes) en comparación con los otros Atelier, por ejemplo, el nuevo sistema de días y de horas dentro del juego, que si bien no es algo completamente nuevo, está renovado y mejorado en esta entrega. Tiene un nuevo estilo de pelea, que aunque es un poco más confuso que en viejas entregas, me parece un buen cambio. Además de esto me parece que la forma de avanzar la historia, el sistema de memoria es una de las mejores cosas que he visto al menos desde Atelier Escha & Logy.

Ahora con lo malo por otra parte... siento que el diseño, tanto los modelos como en lo respecta a personalidades de los personajes es muy plano, si no me equivoco, Hidari, diseñador de los personajes de la previa saga, The Dust Saga ya no está presente, y de ser así, se extraña mucho la colaboración de Hidari en los juegos de Atelier, y no es por menospreciar los diseños de Yuugen, pero los personajes se sienten planos o incluso sobrecargados, teniendo una impresión incluso peor.
La historia no es mala, pero no tiene un impacto grande en el jugador, como en juegos algo antiguos, como Atelier Totori o incluso Ayesha, que tienen un inicio impactante e incluso emotivo. Por cierto, seguramente pocos lo habrán notado, pero, ¿qué pasó con Logy? ¿por qué de la nada olvidó todo lo que respecta a alquimia? como si hubiesen borrado todo lo que respectaba a otros juegos de la saga.
Los fondos, o mapas en general, aunque se aprecia que sean mucho más grandes que en juegos anteriores, se sienten vacíos o incluso muertos, que antiguamente se compensaba mucho mejor.

¿Recomendaría comprar este juego? bueno, si eres un seguidor de la saga, o te llama la atención, es posible, puedes hacerlo bajo tu propio riesgo, si es tu primer juego, o lo ves como una segunda opción... la verdad es que no tanto. Apenas llevo 5 horas jugadas, es poco, pienso terminar el juego, definitivamente, pero tiene muchos errores gráficos y problemas con el port a pc, la historia tan simple y personajes tan poco desarrollados qué la verdad es que de momento no lo veo como uno de los mejores Atelier, menos de los mejores RPG de los últimos tiempos.

31667923.review:
Addicting and relaxing. The game follows a cycle of adventure to gather ingredients/fight monsters > do alchemy and socialize with townspeople > repeat. It's open world-ish but sometimes there's as many story scenes back to back as a linear game. Battle format is typical of the genre, enter battle line up and take turns chosing attack defend item spell. The alchemy is a puzzle minigame that's got some fair depth/interaction with the main game. I enjoy myself playing this and forget to stop playing even after 10 hours straight.

Port's only issue for me is proper controller mapping. Tip: if your controller's start and back button don't work, use keyboard 0 and 1. [b]Important: if it's mapping your controller wrong like it is mine, the only way to skip the opening cutscene is with keyboard 0[/b]. For some reason the game maps my controller (standard xbox one controller) with Y to A, X to Y, and A to X, and puts LB and RB on back and start. I guess you can customize all that in steam big picture, but there's nowhere in game if you don't use that. So anyway that only bothered me for the first hour; despite the prompts being wrong, it's playable. Game runs at nice FPS and resolution, I don't get any crashing. (I guess the FPS was locked at 30 and unlocked with a recent patch? I don't know, but I've got enough frames)

Game is adorable. Like the way Recettear is adorable; an optimistic child inheritor trying to run a family business. Watashi, ganbarimasu.

Some anime industry voice talent in this too. I've heard a few of them elsewhere.

I dropped full price on this, because I wanted a very specific type of game experience, and wasn't willing to settle for whatever $5-$10 thing I could get on sale. And I'm happy with this. This specific one thing is worth more to me than 6 "anythings" would be.

31543948.review:
之前就一直很喜欢工作室系列，尤其是A17，某一天翻游戏的时候发现steam上居然移植了，结果是十分满意的。
虽然工作室的人设一向都很出色，但是我觉得苏菲这一作给人的感觉是最舒服的，有这种感觉和游戏的设定也有很大的关系。
A17取消了时间限制，玩起来就十分的轻松，并且故事背景设置在一个平凡的小镇，没有复杂的世界观，讲述天真少女与不可思议的书的故事，就像童话一样温馨浪漫，配上中世纪的炼金术题材和清新欢快的环境，带来了别具一格的风味，剧情多为温馨的像日常一样的情节，都有一种被治愈的感觉，这是与前作的雅兰德三部曲以及黄昏三部曲完全不同的风格，我认为是相当成功的（[strike] 看起来gust相当了解现在的死肥宅喜欢什么[/strike]）。
这一作的炼金系统也有很大的创新，炼金的过程十分的有趣，不仅仅要注重素材的品质和特性，还在选好素材后增加了根据炼金釜的不同和大小来亲自摆放的设定（在一定程度上也增强了操作性和游戏性），在后期特性的合成设计也非常巧妙，让游戏内容丰富了不少。
战斗方面依然是回合制，增加破防系统，大体上给人的感觉还是不错的。
在采集方面，A17的天气和昼夜系统让在相同的地点采集到的物品和遇到的怪物也会有不同，就更需要时间的安排，在一些时候甚至还能起到渲染气氛的作用。
工作室的模型就不用说了，都不会有什么大毛病（[strike]然而A18苏菲长残了	[/strike]），值得一提的是，这一作的BGM水准都相当的高，整个流程下来每一首BGM都很耐听。游戏的CV阵容也没毛病，相坂优歌的声线很适合苏菲（[strike]其实一开始我还以为是肉松[/strike]）。[strike] 在这里，你甚至可以感受到普拉芙妲满溢的知性（井口裕香）、可以听到六驱（摩妮卡（洲崎绫）给你唱歌。[/strike]
每天的日常就是采集采集，炼金炼金，到了休息日去镇上溜达溜达享受剧情，不管是多少钱买了都不会亏，十分值得一玩的游戏。

31443607.review:
Atelier Sophie เกมส์ซี่รี่ย์นี้เป็นเกมส์แนวเนื้อเรื่อง+ผจญภับ ที่เราจะต้อง หาวัตถุดิบ สู้มอนเตอร์ ผสมของและผจญภัยดันเจี้ยน เนื้อเรื่องของภาคนี้แบบคร่าวๆก็คือ คุณยายที่เสียไปได้ทิ้งร้าน Atelier เอาไว้ให้ นางเอกของเราจึงต้องสืบสานร้านเล่นแร่แปรธาตุนี้เอาไว้ อยู่มาวันหนึ่งก็ได้เจอกับ Platta เป็นหนังสือเล่นแร่แปรธาตุบินได้ ที่จำเรื่องราวในอดีตของตัวเองไม่ได้ โซฟีจึงได้มาช่วย Platta ตามหาความทรงจำกลับคืนมาว่าเธอคือใคร, มาอยู่ที่นี้ได้ยังไงและทำไมถึงเป็นหนังสือ

ถ้าลองสังเกตดีๆจะเห็นตัวเลข A17 บนหัวของเกมส์ หมายความว่าภาคนี้คือภาคที่ 17 แล้วการันตรีถึงชื่อเสียงในการสร้างเกมส์ของค่าย GUST เป็นอย่างดี (ทำมาเกือบ 20 ปี) จุดเด่นที่ทำให้เกมส์นี้ดังก็คือความละเอียดของเนื้อเรื่อง เนื้อเรื่องในเกมส์จะลื่นไหลมาก มีเรื่องตลก, น่ารักและมีเหตุการณ์ให้เรายิ้มได้เสมอ เนื้อหาของเกมส์จะเป็นแนวน่ารักสดใส และเมื่อเราพัฒนาความสัมพันธ์กับตัวละครมากขึ้น ก็จะมีเนื้อเรื่องลับที่เผยออกมาให้เรามากขึ้นเช่นกัน สำหรับคนที่กลัวภาษาอังกฤษไม่ต้องเป็นห่วง เรื่องเรื่องในแต่ละตอนจะสั้นๆง่ายๆ ไม่ทำให้รู้สึกรำคาญอะไร และจำนวนของ Event ที่มีมหาศาล ทำให้เราไม่เหงาระหว่างเล่นเกมส์แน่นอน (สั้นๆแต่มีเยอะ)

ความสนุกของตัวเกมส์ เกมส์นี้เป็นแนวลงดันเจี้ยนล่าของมาผสมปรับแต่งคุณสมบัติที่เราต้องการ ทำให้เราเล่นได้เพลินๆไม่มีเบื่อ มันทำให้มีเป้าหมายในการเล่น ในเกมส์มีสถานที่ให้ผจญภัยมากกว่า 20 ที่ มี Boss ไอเท็มลับต่างให้เก็บมากมาย นอกไปจากนี้ยังมีระบบอื่นๆที่ช่วยให้เล่นเกมส์ได้สนุกอีก เช่น ร้าน Copy ของ (สำหรับของบางชิ้นที่หายากหรือทำยาก ไม่งั้นเซ็งโคตร นั่งทำทีละชิ้น), ระบบ Quest+ข่าวลือที่จะมีเหตุการณ์ต่างๆให้เราทำเช่นวัตถุดิบพิเศษ, Boss เป็นต้น

ข้อดี
-	บทเกมส์เขียนได้โคตรเทพ มันลื่นไหลมาก ทำให้รู้สึกเหมือนกับตัวละครมีชีวิตจริงๆ
-	ตัวละครออกแบบได้น่ารักทุกตัว (ยกเว้นออสก้านะ)
-	ระบบต่อสู้ออกแบบได้เพลินดี ไม่ยุ่งยากอะไร แต่ก็ไม่ได้ง่าย
-	เสียงเพลงก็เพลินดี ทำได้ดี
-	จบเกมส์แล้วยังมีอะไรให้เล่นต่อ

TLDR: Game is pretty fun on normal and hard through the storyline, postgame is an incredibly boring grind with only a few extra bosses.

Cute girls, pretty ordinary plot, shitty keybindings but I worked around them by using autohotkey to rebind everything to my numpad.

Playing through the entire storyline on hard mode was a pretty fun experience. The game can get pretty challenging and it really forces you to think about how to chain together your synths to get the desired traits you want.

However, if you're thinking about clearing all the achievements... better do it on easy, because the post-game bosses are incredibly hard. I found the amount of effort required to min max was ridiculous at post game, so i tuned it down to easy mode, but it still took me about 8-10 hours of post-game grinding to get some half-decent 999 quality gear to beat the demon king. Post-game trait grinding is ridiculously tedious, and to be honest at the end it even felt like a chore.

31126837.review:
Atelier Sophie, the 17th installation of the Atelier series, is a cute, charming game that has you playing as a character with little confidence, and lots of positivity. I will admit that this quality becomes annoying at times, especially with other characters making comments about her 'ability' as an alchemist in the beginning. However, as you level up and develop your skills, the dialouge begins to reflect this and new options open up to you.

I quite enjoyed the system for synthesising and the ability to get new cauldrons. At times, the game could become very grindy and I found myself doing the same things over and over again for hours at a time, especially towards the end. However, I did like that the days and times were not as important as they were in prior games in the series, leaving more time to actually enjoy the game and get into it, than stressing about whether I missed an important event/mission because I was out questing or synthesising.

Altogether, I found the game very enjoyable and it is the first Atelier game that I've followed through to the end of the storyline, which, although predictable at times, was intriguing and fascinating. I enjoyed discovering who Platha (misspelt) was with her and the history of the cauldron and village. All in all, I recommend this game to people who enjoy JRPG style games, crafting games, story driven games, and are fans of the Atelier series.

31096590.review:
This is a good game, if not a bit flawed.

The gameplay generally revolves around collecting items, unlocking recipes and new areas to collect better items by completing challenges, and using your collected items to create better and more powerful equipment and items with alchemy to use in battles. 

As you spend your day in town you'll get little sprinklings of character interaction, unlock characters for your party, and you'll progress the main story by completing the challenges given to you by the Mysterious Book. 

I do not feel that the writing of this game is particularly good, but it's not terrible. It's also the 17th game in the series which makes me feel like the game could have used longer in the oven.

There is also no time limit in this game, which you will either love or not. I grew to appreciate the laid back, freeform nature of the game but it can make the game feel like it lacks urgency, it did bother me at the start.

You'll reach max level just as you're finishing the game, which unlocks a really neat character progression system to make your party stronger, which is great, because it's at this stage that battles become the main focus of the game. There's no story left, and the few recipes you have left to unlock require you to beat progressively more powerful bosses, and to beat them you'll need to make powerful equipment from items you can only get from from the hardest monsters. 

Depending on the kind of player you are, the endgame might be the best part of the game for you, but it does take around 25-30 hours to get there. The difficulty of 2 optional bosses in particular is so extreme I've not been able to beat them, but it'll be a good challenge for when I choose to come back.

In short, this game's not for everybody, but if you like the idea of a laid back, lighthearted JRPG you can pick up and play whenever, you might enjoy it.

This is my first game of the Atelier series. I've been wanting to play games from this series for a very long time, because I do not own any recent consoles(I'm a PC person), and I wasn't deceived.

Atelier Sophie: The Alchemist of the Mysterious Book is a jRPG with a very heavy focus on crafting through Alchemy. The overall feeling of the game is fairly relaxing. The story events progresses even if you don't necessarily aim for them and there's no time limit to do anything. However, the story is not very long, but it isn't so bad if you just take the time to enjoy all the pieces of this relaxing jRPG. I clocked in 50 hours enjoying myself with this game. If your focus isn't completely on story and you're just looking for a fun and relaxing jRPG to play where you can mess around with a crafting system, then definitly look into this game.

30938889.review:
J'ADORE.

Ayant toujours été fan des jeux de craft, j'avais une affection particulière pour la série Atelier. Malheureusement les sorties PC étaient rares... J'ai joué à Atelier Annie dans le passé, le progrès constaté depuis celui-ci m'a très agréablement surpris !

Il s'agit d'un jeu d'ambiance très légère dans un univers paisbile, avec une jeune héroïne déterminée (comme d'habitude) à devenir une alchimiste compétente. Le jeu est basé grandement sur votre progression dans l'art de synthétiser de très nombreux objets essentiels à votre progression : équipements, accessoires, objets de soin, matérieaux, bombes et bien plus encore... vous découvrez les recettes au fur et à mesures en faisant des actions spécifique, qui permettent la progression de l'histoire. Les matériaux de qualité variables doivent être collecté, dans de nombreux endroits présents débloqués au fur et à mesure, et sur les ennemis après les combats.

Le système de craft (qui pour moi s'approche de la perfection dans la matière) est placé au centre du jeu, il passe par un mini-jeu permettant de booster les stats de l'objet crafté. Combiné au fait que les traits (modificateurs et bonus divers) présents sur les matérieaux peuvent être transférés sur l'objet crafté, les possibilités de personnalisation sont extrêmement riches. On peut donc par exemple totalement optimiser les équipements de combat selon son style de jeu. 

J'aime beaucoup l'absence de limite de temps pour la progression du jeu, ce qui rend le jeu beaucoup moins stressant, et même plutôt relaxant.

Je suis moins fan du système de combat, tour par tour, on ne peut pas connaître le niveau de l'ennemi avant le combat, et il est très difficile de fuir un combat après l'avoir déclenché avant d'obtenir l'objet qui facilite cette action. Heureusement, la mort n'est pas punitive.

Les + :
- Très bon système de craft riche et bien pensé, et de nombreux objets personnalisables
- Un inventaire bien designé et donc bien pratique d'utilisation
- Les objets et traits présents sont très riches
- Pas de limite de temps pour les événements, ni pour la progression
- Ambiance légère et reposante
- Perso très beaux et attachants 
- Niveau de difficulté paramétrable
- Boss annexes bien challengeants
- Mort non punitive
- Bonne maniabilité à la manette

Les - :
- Combat tour par tour (préférence perso)
- L'histoire trop "innocente" (et un peu trop simple ?)
- Un peu trop d'events ?
- On peut pas connaître le niveau de l'ennemi avant le combat, et la fuite rendue difficile face aux ennemis puissants

30900476.review:
O jogo Atelier Sophie: The Alchemist of the Mysterious Book (AS:TAotMB, não vou escrever o nome inteiro de novo) é um J-RPG, com uma mistura de exploração e com alquímia de itens e também de aventura. Mas algo que na teoria parece interessante, na prática não é a melhor das coisas.

A ideia do jogo é bem simples, você controla Sophie, uma alquimista, e busca materiais, recursos e itens em áreas com monstros, e fazendo apenas isso você progride no jogo e também na sua história. Ou seja, você não precisa fazer missões muito específicas ou ir precisamente em lugares inexplorados para avançar, apenas jogando no seu ritmo a história do jogo já se desenrola por si só.

O combate é muito legal (ainda bem), ele não é cansativo e nem repetitivo, a dificuldade também é bem balanceada e juntando tudo isso com mais chefões e ataques especiais o jogo fica muito divertido. Armas e amaduras são um pouco limitadas, como o jogo é baseado na alquimia você só libera novas armas se sua alquimia estiver boa, e as vezes você acaba usando os mesmos equipamentos por horas até evoluir a alquimia.

A exploração mesmo sendo um ponto importante do jogo é bem fraca, mapas são muito pequenos e itens coletados ficam se repetindo em várias áreas diferentes, o que faz com que você pare de coletar porque você já vai ter coletado tanto de um item que não vai querer mais dele.

Outro ponto negativo, pelo menos pra mim, é que tive vários, VÁRIOS, bugs visuais durante a jogatina. Pra finalizar, AS:TAotMB é um bom RPG, com o seu combate muito bem feito, alquímia de itens bem interessante e uma história OK, o jogo fica divertido de se jogar e você acaba ignorando os problemas e gostando do jogo.

30878531.review:
优秀的萌豚休闲游戏。
英语难度不高，高中水平就可畅玩。现在貌似也有汉化补丁了。
人设精美[spoiler]苏菲最萌了⁄（⁄　⁄•⁄ω⁄•⁄　⁄）⁄[/spoiler]，人物的立绘，建模，动作在萌豚游戏中都是很优秀的。[spoiler]光看苏菲卖萌就值了。~\(≧▽≦)/~[/spoiler]
作为炼金工作室系列，炼金自然是游戏的核心。游戏中用的一切道具都要自己通过炼金获得（后期兽耳loli可以帮助补充消耗），甚至炼金锅都要通过炼金来升级。衣服、武器虽然不用自己合成，但打造的材料也要自己合成。
游戏当中的炼金并不是一成不变的，也不是简单的用高级材料堆叠。炼金的核心是在炼金锅中合理的摆放自己的材料。前期炼金锅是４×４　５×５或更大的方框，而每一种材料都有特定的形状，甚至同种材料因为品质、效果的不同而有不同的形状。每个材料也有自己的特殊效果，可以选择继承到成品上。每种材料又有一个颜色属性（大体对应金木水火土什么的）。每将一个材料放入锅中，材料周围的格就会增强，继续把材料放上就可以的到更多的点数。（锅中的没个格也有特定的颜色，放上相应的也有加成）你要做的就是得到最多的点数。而相应的限制也不少，首先是材料奇怪的形状，让你很难摆到理想的效果。很多情况光单纯的点数很难达到要求，当锅中某种颜色占面积最大时，相应的颜色点数会整体得到加成。点数的增加意味着道具的到更强的特殊属性，材料的品质将影响道具的品质，材料上的效果可以选部分继承到道具上。
你要用手头有限的材料尽可能炼出最好的物品，每次炼金都充满了随机的挑战，都好像要求一个最优解。[spoiler]而且每次都可以看苏菲卖萌~\(≧▽≦)/~[/spoiler]
而且游戏对操作几乎无要求，也基本没有时间限制，非常适合休闲时游玩。
推荐剁手。

30869920.review:
거스트의 아틀리에 시리즈 중 처음으로 스팀에 등장한 게임입니다.

주 컨텐츠가 연금 소재 채집 및 조합이다 보니 게임이 아기자기한 반면, 볼륨 및 맵은 기대했던것 보다는 작은 느낌입니다.
그래도 제 취향과는 잘 맞다 보니 연금술로 조합놀이 하며 아이템 제작하다 보면 시간이 훌쩍 가버려서 재미있게 즐겼습니다.

도전과제도 무난히 100% 달성가능하고 게임의 난이도 자체도 높지 않은지라 부담없이 느긋하게 즐길수 있었습니다.
반대로 얘기하면 액션과 스피드감, 호쾌한 타격감, 높은 난이도 등을 좋아하시는 분들께는 지루할 듯 합니다.

안타까운 점은 스토리나 캐릭터들의 대사를 이해하지 못하면 재미가 반감될 수 밖에 없는데,
국내 콘솔판 유통사 한글화라 스팀용 PC 버전은 한글화 가능성이 전혀없다는 점입니다.

또한, PC 이식을 "[b]거지[/b]"같이 하기로 유명한 코에이 테크모가 거스트를 인수해서 내놓은 상황이다 보니 역시나 스팀판의 최적화 및 콘솔판 대비 텍스처 다운그레이드 등의 문제는 여전한데다 DLC 누락 및 크래시 등의 문제가 있어도 거의 해결해줄 생각을 안해서 유저들이 직접 해결하고 있는 상황입니다.
그나마 초반에 멀티코어 CPU점유율 100% 문제 딱 하나는 수정해 줘서 고마워해야 할 지경일 정도로 코에이 테크모의 PC판 홀대는 변함이 없습니다.

30864962.review:
[h1] Atelier Sophie: The Alchemist of the Mysterious Book [/h1]

DISCLAIMER: I received this product for no cost for the purpose of reviewing. However, this does not affect my views and opinions of the game.

Atelier Sophie: The Alchemist of the Mysterious Book, is part of the long running Atelier series by Gust Corporation and Koei Tecmo. The game is a 3D anime-style, turn-based combat, crafting game. As in all of the atelier games, the player takes control of a young female alchemist with a desire to reach a certain goal. In this case, Sophie is the main character of this title, and she wishes to become as great of an alchemist as her late grandmother was. Sophie finds a mysterious book which comes to life, talking and flying about, after she writes an alchemy recipe within it. 

The mysterious book named; Plachta, is suffering from amnesia, though writing recipes within her pages seems to restore her memories. Plachta decides to help Sophie become a great alchemist and in return, Sophie will write all the recipes she discovers within the magical book in order to recover her memories.

--------

[b] Graphics: 8 / 10 [/b] 

Even though anime-style graphics are hit or miss with some people, the title's art-style is great. There's a lot of unique character design, and the art assets are very colourful, even during the night cycle. The terrain is also very nice looking. Although there are a few areas within the game that look similar, most of the locations that the player will travel too are very unique and have their own charm about them. There's a good amount of enemy variety within the game, though some of the enemies are slightly modified versions of others, with maybe a colour change or different clothes/accessories added to them. The cut-scenes as well as the opening scene to the game are also high quality. The game will run fine on any mid to high tier GPU and CPU, though playing around with the setting might yield a better frame rate for those with a lower tier/budget set up.  

--------

[b] Sound: 8 / 10 [/b]

The music in the game is very lovely. There's a lot of little folk tracks that really suit the art style and theme of the game. Although these tracks can feel a bit repetitive at times, they're still quite nice. This, in addition to the great voice acting within the game make the sound assets really solid. Some of the areas within the game have different tracks, and on top of this, the tracks will change depending on the time of day. The soundtracks fit in well with each of the locations and as mentioned before, really fit in well with the overall motif of the title. 

--------

[b] Mechanics: 8 / 10 [/b]

The game-play might be a little confusing at first, especially for those who haven't played a title from this series, though the mechanics become a little easier to understand as the player progresses. Alchemy is a big part of the game, as it should be. Crafting new items, and gaining new recipes is also how the story progresses. Alchemy allows the player to craft various items and tools to help them in combat or as part of a quest. Products created from alchemy can also be sold to shops to make gold. Alchemy is more than just putting items together. There are different qualities and traits of items that can be passed down to resulting product. In addition to this, there are various items that can be used per recipe. The final product is influenced by the ingredients used, and the way that the compound is brewed.

The player will spend most of their time gathering items. New areas will open up as the game progress. There will be gathering nodes and enemies at all of these sites. Certain items and enemies can only be found in specific places, so travelling and backtracking to locations is important. Different hours of the day will also yield different items at some of of these locations, though during the evening and night times, enemies are much stronger, so it is important to have a strong party. 

While traversing through areas, the player will encounter enemies and will have to fight them (unless they run away from them). The game's combat system is very basic. It's a turn-based battle system in which enemies and allies will each have their own set of stats and skills, using them to defeat each-other. Levelling up will increase stats as well as unlock new skills to use in battle. The combat is not the main focus of the game, so it's a little more understandable with it being so bare bones. It's definitely the weakest part of the game. 

The town also has many different stores that sell items that can assist with alchemy or combat. The café has a bulletin board where the player can obtain quests and rumours. Rumours are sort of like tips as to where to find special items, though some of these tips only work while  the rumour is active. 

During certain times of the day, when the player enters a part of the town, events may occur depending on which other character is in that area. These small "random" events add to the character's depth and give nice side stories as the game progresses.

--------

[b] Final Personal Remarks: [/b]

The game is a lot of fun. It make take a little bit of time to start off and get a hand of everything, though the art, music and game-play are all a great experience. I've played one Atelier game in the past before, it was for the Nintendo DS, I had a lot of fun with it but it was a very short title. It also had multiple endings and everything sort of had a deadline. This title is a lot more relaxed. Although there is a time-flow mechanic, there is no pressure to finish anything quickly or get as much done as possible within a certain time frame. The only complaint I really have about the game is that the town is quite barren. There's hardly anyone in the town and even in the shops there's usually only one or two other NPCs. This was probably done to avoid too much clutter on the screen, though it would have been nice to see more civilians walking around and have more NPCs to interact with. Regardless, I found the title very enjoyable. 

Thanks to the devs for giving me the opportunity to review the game, as well as anyone who took this review into consideration, I hope it helped.

30843371.review:
[h1]Atelier Sophie: The Alchemist of the Mysterious Book[/h1]
[b]Developer[/b]: KOEI TECMO GAMES CO., LTD.
[b]Publisher[/b]: KOEI TECMO GAMES CO., LTD.

[b]Introduction[/b]
==========
I have not played an Atelier game since Atelier Iris: Eternal Mana back on the Playstation 2. I absolutely loved that game and how it blended combat with your interactions with objects in the game world. You could extract mana from that barrel sitting in the corner of town and use it to make an item to damage enemies or heal your party! I went into Atelier Sophie with somewhat high expectations, having loved Atelier Iris, and knowing that the series itself turned out to be fairly long. 

[b]Gameplay[/b]
==========
Atelier Sophie revolves almost entirely around Alchemy and the crafting of different items. Sophie is a fledgling alchemist who has inherited a lot of things from her late grandmother, who was her village's premiere alchemist. She made a lot of medicine for the townsfolk and was beloved by all. However, Sophie is very different from her grandmother in that she is somewhat of a ditz and very carefree. She is, however, quite dedicated (maybe even obsessed) to learning alchemy to help people. This is basically her entire character, and therein lies my first issue with this game. The characters are very bland and oftentimes one dimensional. Another playable character, Oskar, is so focused on plants and botany that this is literally all he talks about. He also looks like he might have been Shovel Knight in his younger years (Haha!). By far the most interesting character is the book, Plachta. Plachta is a special book with a will of her own. Plachta can fly and talk to Sophie and her friends, and tells them that she has lost her memory. This is the entire point of the game: restoring Plachta's memories. This is done by gathering materials, crafting items, and writing recipes into Plachta's blank pages. Each time a recipe is written, a small portion of her memories return. 

Speaking of characters, in my time playing...in the main town a new character was introduced almost constantly. Leave Sophie's house? New character! Go to the cafe to pick up quests? Three new characters! Go explore outside of town then return to drop off your spoils? Two new characters! I felt like everytime I transistioned to an area I was having a new character thrown at me. This slowed down the pacing of the game, and it's already slow enough. Many of these characters were not interesting or important enough to warrant such an intro, but they're there anyway.

There are three things you'll be doing alot of in Atelier Sophie: gathering materials, crafting items, and fighting monsters. Here's where I thought I might be dragged into the game further, but sadly I was a tad disappointed. Materials are EASILY found and are EVERYWHERE outside of town. There is no challenge to finding them whatsoever, which I woul dhave enjoyed a bit more. Several quests or battles could have been designed aroudn this, but during what time I could play before getting utterly bored, I did not run into such things. Crafting is a little better, but ultimately is very simple. Each item has a recipe, and many portions of the recipe can be filled with many materials. Some recipes call for very specific items, but these recipes are very few. Battles are very simple, and often just boring diversions. You can attack, learn skills, use items, or swap "stances". There's Offensive and Defensive Stances. Just choose Defensive Stance if you nee dto soak a big attack, otherwise stay in Offensive. The bar on the left shows turn orders and it also gives a hint at what monsters will do when their turns come up. One small gripe I have about the crafting system and battles is that you cannot heal yourself with items outside of battle. You have to rest at home or use healing skills in battle. 

[b]Graphics[/b]
==========
Absolutely gorgeous. That's the perfect way to describe how this game looks. It's very bright, vibrant, and colorful. Every character has a great design, and their animations are very well done. This is probably my favorite aspect of the game.

Towns and fields are very pretty, although field locations can be quite small and empty. You'll see monsters running around and material gathering points, but otherwise many areas are very bland. Many of the early areas are just tiny ones...you see the entire area at a glance. Later on, these areas will have caves and such to expand them. They still look nice, despite their shortcomings.

[b]Sound and Music[/b]
==========
I don't know how else to explain this section except with the words "bare minimum". Most music in the game is very simple. None of the tunes are complex or engaging, not even the battle music. It isn't very gripping or gets you in the mood to fight, and I feel like that's a big downside for me. I hold the belief that a LOT of the game can be influenced by it's music. Mood and tone, direction and pacing...all of which can be affected by the music. Sadly, Atelier Sophie flounders in this area. The only theme I really liked was the main town theme. It's upbeat and catchy, and very well sets the mood of being in town. Sound effects are a little better, albeit a little repetitive.

[b]Performance[/b]
==========
Overall, I didn't really notice any problems performance-wise. Framerate was really steady, holding at acceptable levels of 60+ and rarely ever dropping lower. No random bugs or crashes, no hangups or stuttering. There are quite a few video and audio options in the pre-game launcher, so make sure you configure things to your liking before playing. All of my playtime was with a controller, and the default control scheme was quite good. I didn't feel the need to tweak it whatsoever.

[b]Final Thoughts[/b]
==========
Despite it's many shortcomings, I feel like it's still a decent RPG. Not quite as great as the predessessors I had played years back, but it still has some merit to it. While it might not be to my tastes, it might be up someone else's alley for sure. It's definitely a slower, more casual paced RPG. It has some interesting systems in place, but they just aren't complex enough for me. Pick it up on sale if you have any doubts about it.

[b]Gameplay Demo[/b]
==========
https://youtu.be/iLYQynWqwGo

[b]Nerd House Verdict[/b]:
==========
[h1][b] Recommended[/b][/h1]

30831333.review:
簡易レビューです。

-------------------------
2017/04/16追記
アップデートパッチが配信され錬金術パネルの処理落ちによるfps低下は解消されました。
DLCが適用されていなかった問題も修正
------------------------

評価は正直 ”おすすめ” でも ”おすすめしません” でもないが、どちらか選ばないとレビューできないので ”おすすめしません” にしました。

一番初めに、「フィリスのアトリエ(Atelier Firis)」が日本語対応したのに対してこちらは日本語未対応なので注意したい。同日発売した「よるのないくに(Night of Azure)」も日本語未対応。

もう値段が安い時点で(タイトルに日本語がないとか)日本語対応はお察しと思ってましたので諦めています。明らかにフィリスを売りたい買って下さい感が強いんで、どうしても日本語で遊びたいのであれば日本語対応しているフィリスを買ったほうがいいでしょう。

音声が日本語なので、ストーリーの理解など問題ないですが、字幕の説明が英語なので日本語の独特の説明が見れないのであまりオススメしにくい。(これはフレンドのフィリスのアトリエを視聴した時に思ったこと)

ゲームとしては面白く、アトリシリーズはこのゲームが初めてですが錬金術の画面でのパズル感覚の錬金術のパネルは新鮮でした。キャラも可愛いですし。

ただ、残念なところはキャラクターのモデリングやテクスチャに気合が入っているのはわかるが、街の中の人の少なさや一部ダンジョンの平坦すぎるマップで驚いた。多少の起伏があってもいい。それに街の人の少なさは賑わいを感じないし、変に街が小綺麗すぎて人の生活感がまるでなく違和感を感じる。

[strike]CPUの高負荷な問題は、初期に配信されたパッチで解決したが錬金術のパネルのところで処理落ちがあり15~30FPSまで落ち込む問題は解消していません。このままなのかもしれない。[/strike]
アップデートで解消済み

去年あたりから和ゲーの日本語対応が改善されつつある現状で今回の対応は残念。

十年前有了PS2的时候第一次接触这个系列的作品A9认识到这个作品，随后也把A10给通完了，可惜A11开始平台就更替为PS3。。因此也就再没我玩过这个系列了，也就看过A15的动画化作品。。然而如今A17登陆PC平台就立刻买了下来[spoiler] ，可惜没有官中[/spoiler]。。。等到开学也有可以用的汉化补丁，因此断断续续通完了。。

剧情（9.5/10） 作为不可思议系列的第一作开始了新的剧情，索菲与普拉芙妲的冒险故事，正如人偶师所述，两个人的成长故事确实很棒。不必什么惊天动地大举动，就是这种平凡简单的故事，点点滴滴的累积起来才更为深刻。
声优（9.5/10） 鱼香[spoiler] 再次[/spoiler]献声小黄书，相坂优歌献声索菲。
音乐（9.5/10） 个人觉得BGM都挺不错的，而且剧中歌也都很赞。Rurutia献唱的主题曲和片尾曲都很棒。。wwww
内容（9.0/10） 隔了6代再次玩，个人感觉操作还不错，就是技能种类少，果然该作靠炼金术才是王道23333然而打到魔王却要靠平A。。装备与特性太重要了。。一直到最后快通关一周目我才发现炼金系列里居然可以旋转。。2333
画面（9.5/10） CG都很棒，画面也挺精美的，模型做的也还能用心。。

总体来说，个人体验还是挺推荐的，据说是该系列可以作为入门级别的了www。。其实里面有很多小细节可以去关注，会感受到gust制作组的用心。。。期待除了A17与A18以外还能有该系列登上PC平台。。当然最好有官中。。2333

30815934.review:
Atelier Sophie is a great add to the atelier series. 

I'd mostly recommend it to casuals, youngings or people with a weakness for cute games.
It doesn't have a big story, and the characters motivations are easily understandable but not really deep. 
There IS a story there however, but the game is more focused on exploring and crafting.

There are many characters to choose between for your party, from a gunslinger, to a knight, to a fat guy with a shovel. I ended up with a female-only party, mostly because almost every single male character in the game looks.. weird. The one normal looking dude is someone who won't join my party! (Also known as the blacksmith) The great thing about this is even if you don't use certain characters in your party, they will level up, and gain ability points together with the ones you actually use. So if you suddenly want to change things up you won't have to grind for hours for that character to become equally strong. (You will however have to spend time to create proper equipment for them. But that's alchemy, and you'll do that for fun anyways)

Unlike some atelier games, atelier sophie doesn't have any timers or time limit on searching a field. One action equals one hour, and you can stay in said map for as long as your bags can handle. There is also different monsters, and different loots, depending on if it's night or day, and also depending on weather.


There are some negative sides with the game I'd like to point out however..
- I've encountered three different crashing bugs, which made me loose four hours on progress the first time. Which is when I noticed there were no autosaves. Atelier didn't crash often during my 70 hours of gameplay, those three different bugs happened maybe five times, but with no autosave it was always a risk.

- There are loading screens or moments of waiting between everything. From one map to the other. From starting battle to actually using skills, etc. It drove me insane to the point I could only play the game while watching TV at the same time.

- After defeating the final boss of the story, there are two bosses you'll need to defeat (that only spawns after defeating the final boss) for achievements. These bosses are extremely hard, I didn't much enjoy spending hours farming for better gear and more levels after technically finishing the game. I changed the difficulty to easy even and I couldn't even put a dent in the final boss of those two. (demon king).

You definitly get a lot for your money.

30711894.review:
I finally finished the game, wouldn't say I explored everything yet but Sophie's story has finally ended. Probably friendship value, godlike end game stats, and some recipe ideas left that I haven't explore. Alright, here's review.

Gust games has always left me a huge impact for it's story, along with it's beautiful soundtrack and amazingly illustrated characters.

The gameplay was cool like any other Atelier games, exploring dungeon with material to synthesize something and getting the traits and effect you wanted was hell of a fun while making sure you're getting that decent equip to maximize your weapon nor accesory stats to overpowered monsters or just make fun of them how weak they were when they was stronger than you.

First time player may find synthesizing confusing but once you get the hang of it, it's addicting and you wouldn't even notice how time has flew to get your shit together. 

Soundtrack haven't changed much prior to old Atelier serier, just some of those classic beautiful Gust JRPG styles soundtracks. 

In conclusion, I wouldn't expain much for this, but you ought to have this game if you're looking for old school JRPG since the Playstation era.

30614389.review:
[h1]การผจญภัยครั้งใหม่ของซีรีย์เล่นแร่แปรธาตุ มาถึงมือชาว PC แล้ว[/h1]

สารภาพตามตรงก่อนว่า ซีรีย์ Atelier ผมไม่รู้จักและไม่เคยเล่นด้วยซ้ำ เคยได้ยินแต่คนอื่นๆ ที่เป็นแฟนเกมหรือคอเกม J-RPG พูดถึงกัน แต่ตอนนี้ทาง Koei Tecmo และ GUST ได้พอร์ตเกมนี้ ลงบน PC มาให้เราได้สัมผัสกันแล้ว

Atelier Sophie: The Alchemist of the Mysterious Book เป็นเกมในซีรีย์ Atelier ภาคที่ 17 ที่เริ่มเรื่องราวในปฐมบทใหม่ ผ่านการผจญภัยของโซฟี เด็กสาวผู้สืบทอด Atelier จากคุณย่าหรือยายของเธอที่เสียไป ต้องการฝึกฝนเพื่อที่จะเป็นนักเล่นแร่แปรธาตุ จนมาพบเจอกับ พลัฟต้า หนังสือมหัศจรรย์ที่บินได้ พูดได้ และไม่มีความทรงจำของตนในอดีตหลงเหลืออยู่ ด้วยเหตุนี้จึงทำให้โซฟีเข้าสู่การผจญภัยสุดมหัศจรรย์เพื่อฝึกฝนตนเองและกู้ความทรงจำของพลัฟต้าคืนมา

ตัวเกมจะเป็นรูปแบบ J-RPG ที่มีระบบวัน-เวลา ผสมกับ Dungeon Crawler ที่เปิดโอกาสให้ผู้เล่นเข้าไปสำรวจดันเจี้ยนต่างๆ วิ่งเก็บสะสมวัตถุดิบ นำไปใช้ในการเล่นแร่แปรธาตุในการฝึกฝนความสามารถของโซฟี เพื่อดำเนินเนื้อเรื่อง หรือจะต่อสู้กับมอนเตอร์เก็บเลเวลตัวละคร โดยระบบต่อสู้จะเป็นรูปแบบ Turn-Based ในแบบที่เราคุ้นเคยจากหลายๆ เกม แต่ในส่วนที่ทำให้เกมนี้เด่นกว่าเกมอื่นก็คือ ระบบ ChainLink ซึ่งเราจะต้องเก็บเกจ Chain จากการโจมตีศัตรูหรือถูกศัตรูโจมตี ให้เกิน 200 เพื่อให้ตัวละครใช้ท่าซัพพอร์ตกัน และหากเก็บได้ถึง 300% ก็จะเป็นการใช้ Special Attack โจมตีเหมือนเป็นท่าไม้ตาย หรือ จะเป็น Special Guard เพื่อตั้งรับการโจมตีก็ได้เช่นกัน แต่ในส่วนนี้ ผู้เล่นเองก็ต้องวางลำดับเทิร์นตัวละครดีๆ ว่าจะให้ตัวละครไหนเป็นคนใช้สกิลด้วยเช่นกัน เพราะสกิลนี้จะใช้เกจ ChainLink ทั้งหมด 300% และหากสกิลถูกใช้ไปแล้วเราก็จะต้องมาเก็บใหม่ให้เต็มอีกครั้งถึงจะใช้ได้

และอีกจุดเด่นหนึ่งที่เป็นตัวชูโรงของเกมนี้คือ การเล่นแร่แปรธาตุ หรือ การสังเคราะห์ไอเทม (Synthesis) จะใช้รูปแบบของเกมพัซเซิล ให้ผู้เล่นวางวัตถุดิบที่เปรียบเสมือนเป็นบล็อกสี่เหลี่ยบแบบต่างๆ เหมือนเกม Tertis ใส่ลงไปในตารางสี่เหลี่ยมขนาดใหญ่ วัตถุดิบแต่ละอย่างก็จะมีจำนวนช่องไม่เหมือนกัน การวางวัตุดิบในช่องต่างๆ จะได้โบนัสต่างกัน ผลของไอเทมที่ได้หลังผสมก็จะต่างกันด้วย ฉะนั้นการผสมแต่ละครั้งก็ควรวางแผนดีๆ ว่าจะผสมยังไงให้ได้ผลลัพธ์ดีที่สุด

ตัวเกมโดยรวมถือว่าอยู่ในระดับที่ดี เป็นอีกหนึ่งเกม J-RPG ที่เล่นได้เพลินๆ แต่ดันมาเฟลในส่วนของการพอร์ตลง PC ซึ่งในช่วงแรกๆ ที่เกมออก ตัวเกมมีการรัน CPU ที่สูงมากกว่าปกติที่มันควรจะเป็น (ปัญหานี้ ปัจจุบันทีมงานแพทช์แก้ไขเรียบร้อยแล้ว) ซึ่งแทบจะเรียกว่าเป็น Console Port ตรงๆ แต่นอกจากนั้นตัวเกมก็ไม่มีปัญหาบั๊กอะไรที่กวนใจระหว่างเล่น ผมทดสอบเล่นมาจน Plat 100% แล้วไม่เจอปัญหาและไม่เจอบั๊กที่ทำให้ไปต่อไม่ได้ สบายใจได้ครับ

สรุปรวม
+ ระบบการต่อสู้ที่เข้าใจง่ายและไม่ซับซ้อนมาก
+ สามารถเลือกปรับระดับความยากได้ตลอดเวลา ตั้งแต่ Easy (ง่าย) ไปจนถึง Despair (ยากสุด)
+/- ระบบสังเคราะห์ไอเทมที่ค่อนข้างซับซ้อน ต้องคิดเยอะมากในการผสมไอเทมเพื่อให้ได้ผลดีที่สุด สำหรับการตีบอสในช่วง Post-Game
+/- ระบบเวลาในเกมที่มีผลกับอีเว้นท์ของตัวละครและการตามเก็บวัตถุดิบ ไม่มีผลกับเนื้อเรื่องและฉากจบ
- การพอร์ตลง PC ที่ยังติดรูปแบบคอลโซลอยู่

ปล. อาจมีบางส่วนที่ผมไม่ได้พูดถึง เพื่อไม่ให้เป็นการสปอย ผมจึงขอข้ามส่วนนี้ไป โปรดเข้าใจด้วยฮะ ^_^

30519045.review:
Game says i'm 70+ hours in. Maybe it's the steam offline mode.

I haven't spent so many hours in a single player game for like over 10 years. And this one i get so addicted to it.

This is the first game for me in this series. However, even normal difficulty will give you the incentive to get better in alchemy after you encounter other formidable non story bosses. And once i got into it, i improved a lot on the battle and now i can play on highest difficulty. This process is so satisfying after you learned different mechanics of the game, synthesized literally every equinment needed in battle and finally beat strong enemies with them. 

This game may suffer pacing issues especially for some players who are used to games with fast paced stories. But soon i figured out this playstyle just brought me back to the good old harvest moon series where you don't want to hustle and get the main story going, but enjoy a game called "daily lives of the characters".

Speaking of the characters, they are extremely detailed. And I have to point out that Sophie is so cute that she is one of the reasons that keeps me into this game. Other characters are also very adorable.

The price is also really fair with all the dlcs included (missing ones are downloadable). There's also customisable bgm for your own taste including all those from the past games.

A game that i would regret not buying. Bought its sequel as well, but i'm still not done with this one :)

Framerates are all over the place for no apparent reason, textures are [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=863783065]bugged[/url] after you fast travel. As far as I heard, they ported the PS3 version of the game instead of the PS4, and on PS4, this game runs fine, so it's purely PC issues. For now I would not recommend playing until the community fully fixes the game's issues or the developers do, but the latter is unlikely it seems.

30473616.review:
Before I start my wall of text, I'm a fan of the series as I've played all Atelier games before Sophie (except the otome game one on PSP) even the ones that aren't named Atelier. So there's going to be bias about this. I'll try to keep my review short.

Setting/Story
- The story isn't mindblowing or anything but it is nice. It gets better halfway through the game
- This is one of the things I really like about. The worldbuilding is good as it is told by the (not so graphically pleasing) environments, the conversations, and the items.
- You have an encyclopedia in your menu that shows the details of the items and places. The conversations in those make it cute and gives you not all of the details but more hint of a hint of the item itself and probably the setting of this game. I really like the small details in the Atelier series
- Even the character interactions get better at halfway

Time limit
- No time limits. That means you can take it easy with the story, the alchemy, requests, alchemy, and other stuff.

Gameplay
- It's more similar to the recent Atelier games. The usual JRPG turn-based system bundled with the alchemy system
- Try turning the difficulty up a notch, hard at least. 
- The game gets better at halfway through the game as you get more access to items 
- Half the time you'll be staring at your synthesis screen making your ultimate item
- The post game is where it's at. You will put your skills (crafted items) to test against strong enemies and bosses.

Soundtrack
- It's still the same people who does the music with the addition of a new guy from the Arland games.
- Bretty gud. I like how the music is still reminscent of any 90s games and with more recent-ish style.

tl;dr
This isn't the best in the series but it's still good if you can endure the first half of the game as the story and the gameplay gets better later. As for people not familiar with the series, you might not like it as everything seems slow but it's a good JRPG to just take your time with if you're in it for simple combat and good music.

42小时一周目全成就通关。作为没时间的GUST脑残分一本满足

索菲这代可说是系列最休闲的一部作品非常适合刚接触炼金系列的大家入门
由于没有时间概念你也不必拯救世界，做课题，还钱，找妈妈更不用发展国家所以本作索菲你甚至可以开局睡1个月都没事!
新的炼金系统（拼图，炼金釜种类），素材特性特征摸索起来非常有趣也烧脑的
不过这也正是炼金系列的核心和卖点呀!（当然人设也是其中之一）
战斗上由于这代有着许多强力的特性与附魔，并且所有角色都能使用道具（部分限制）
只要熬过前期那没钱，没强力特性与装备，更没有技能的时期后就能拳打困难脚踢绝望
个人非常喜欢gust在图鉴里每个道具，魔物一个个都附带了小小段的角色介绍。
这些信息能让玩家很好的容易再索菲的世界观与了解角色之间的羁绊。真的是不得不拜下GUST的用心

在这我要稍微吐槽下流言这系统我TM.刷最后个流言boss刷了半小时才出来.....

30385079.review:
This is the first time being introduced to the Atelier series, I've heard about it, but never could find a copy of any of the game series in the stores where I live.
 I dont know why, but when playing this game brang back childhood memories. Being outside, being with friends, seeing people you know in town, hanging out, that sort of thing.
 The whole game is charming, set in idyllic rural small town and it's surrounding areas. The story is good, vast and interwoven. I always discover new things as they pop up as I make my way through the game.
The alchemy crafting is pretty fun and is like potato chips, you can't stop with just one. It's that addicting. 
The combat is based on an offense/defense stance and depending what your stance is, different abilities are used.
 There is another Atelier game that just got released on steam and will be getting that as well. Thanks Koei Techmo. You just got me hooked on a new series. :)

[h1]素材名や文章など会話以外ほぼ日本語翻訳しています。[/h1]
[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=etTKtvTB-I0[/url]
[h1]参考にしていただければ幸いです。[/h1]
[u]【4月16日更新】#4(後編)動画追加しました。[/u]モチベや納得いく日本語訳にかなり時間がかかってしまっています、申し訳ございません。分かりやすい日本語翻訳が出来るよう善処していきます。※間違った翻訳していたら指摘お願いします。
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
　【レビュー】
【4月16日追記】PS4やPSvitaがないのでPC版でプレイしようかと思い購入しました。
　皆さんのレビューの通りもともと日本語版だと思うと[h1]楽しさが半減します。[/h1][u]何故日本のゲームをプレイするために辞書や翻訳機を用意しなければならないのかと[/u]そう思いました。[u]字幕、素材名など文字はすべて"英語(English)"[/u](ボイスは日本語選択できます)です。３０分プレイするのに2～3時間かけて翻訳するのって辛いとは思いませんか?
　しかし文句を言ってもたぶんKOEIさんは日本語化をさせないでしょう。
　私にとってこのJRPGが初でしたのでゲーム性やキャラクターの個性はとても面白いし楽しいと思っています。日本語版ならもっと楽しいのに…と思いますがKOEIさんが日本語版をリリースするまでPC版は英語しかないんです。しょうがないと割り切って英語版をプレイするかPS4版などに移るか…。となるとこのゲームの為だけにPSVita.PS4を買う人はほぼ0に近いと思います。
　現在私は気ままにプレイしながら、私を含めPCでプレイしている人たちが楽しくプレイが出来ように微力ながら翻訳を続けています(まぁ不評が多いんですけれども)(笑)
　【私的に】※日本語版でないというのには[u]"オススメしない"[/u]にしたいところですがゲーム性等はとてもよかったので[u]"オススメ"[/u]と評価しました。
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Finally completed this game. The last time I played Atelier series was Mana Khemia 2 on PS2. I'm glad KT brings this to Steam.

First, the initial state of the port has some bad points. The DLCs are not properly unlocked, and massive frame drop on menu and item crafting. Both of this are fixed by fan patch (they're awesome), check the Steam Discussion to get it. Although KT is the one who should fixed this, not customer. Once you put the fix, the game runs awesome and smooth. You can override the graphic setting from your GPU control panel to put more Anti Aliasing and Anisotropic Filtering if you want to.

The graphic is pretty and easy on eyes, a good "translation" from anime style to 3D. Dungeon and the city design are pretty, you might enjoy your walk. Item crafting is fun (but sometime frustrating), you must guess how to passing a good or required effect and upgrade your synthesized items. Both soundtrack and songs are awesome, setting the mood correctly. The story itself are not grand, but satisfying, and the comedy part made me laugh.

Now for the mixed part; like I said earlier, you need the fix files to make this game smooth. The battle does not offer much other than usual turn-based battle. And personally, I don't quite like how the enemies spawn in map. Sometimes they just pop out in front or behind you, forcing you to battle with them suddenly. The last one is minor, the story mechanic might confused you how to progress the story.

Overall, if you like a game about items crafting, exploration with good dungeon, turn-based battle, and a daily life about young alchemist: Get this game.

30332529.review:
本作是工作室系列的第17作，也作为不可思议系列的开篇之作，该系列革新之作，但是革新得并不完整
我个人感觉这次的移植还是不错的。
同时也是工作室系列登录PC的作品之一（其次是A1，A2[spoiler] 两作同时于2000年的4月28日移植到PC [/spoiler]以及A18）
本作对于刚入坑工作室系列的萌新是极好的选择。
我个人推荐用手柄来玩……键盘操作在采集遇到怪物的时候略蛋疼……QWQ
==键位操作==
以下关于键盘键位操作：
移动：W，A，S，D
确认（A按钮）：空格或者L
返回或取消或跳跃（B按钮）：回车或者；或者Backspace键
打城镇开地图（Y按钮）：O
挥舞手杖（X按钮）：K
LB按钮：I（大写i）
RB按钮：P
小键盘功能：
旋转相机左Num4
旋转相机右Num6
旋转相机向上Num8
旋转相机向下Num2
镜头复位（重置镜头）：Num5
跳OP：Num0（不要抱怨OP跳不过）
[spoiler] 
这个游戏的确能跳OP
这个游戏的确能跳OP
这个游戏的确能跳OP
（重要的事情要说三遍）
[/spoiler]
退出键：左上角Esc
==游戏的优缺点==
优点：
1.音乐风格有点重回阿兰德时代的风格（音乐不错），大喜。
2.两位画师的人设都很棒
3.剧情上还是比较跳跃，但不影响游戏进程。
4.GUST在本作上直接放弃了时间限制，这对于玩家来说是极好的。
5.能够静坐研究一整天的调合系统，大大增加了这个游戏的趣味性[spoiler] （虽然这个系统在每一作炼金工作室都会出现，甚至连手游也不放过，不愧是核心系统……）[/spoiler]
6.能够随时随地切换难度。
缺点：
1.不能改键位。（不能自定义键位）
2.游戏的文本上的操作说明完全照搬主机版。（这样照搬键位，对萌新或者老玩家都不利，而且还是在PC上面……）
3.用键盘操作的话，镜头旋转在右方小键盘，这对于不能改建位的游戏，固然是不太友好。
4.对于一部分入门级A卡，运行该游戏的时候，打完普尼或者不打直接逃走都有几率会出现普尼的黑影BUG。（几率较小）
5.战斗系统想法好，但却导致了平A过于强大。
-------------可能遇到的问题-------------
我遇到的已知问题分享给各位或许能够帮助一下遇到同样问题的玩家
（该栏为原版不打第三方中文补丁的，我所遇到的问题与解决方法）
问题1：游戏有音乐但是没有配音。
解决方法：电脑系统音频设置改成立体声道
问题2：游戏无论用什么方法都打不开
解决方法：下载游戏所必要的相关组件。
问题3：入门级A卡运行时打了普尼或者打普尼的时候逃跑，怪物持续出现剪影（黑影）
解决方法：重新进入该地图
个人没有遇到过该游戏停止工作，或是闪退的现象。
-------------个人对于该游戏的评分-------------
个人评分：8.5/10
此测评还会更新

Fetch Quest Simulator. And It's surprisingly good and relaxing.
Yes, relaxing. Now that the game doesn't have those terrible time limits, you can actually spend as much time as you want fighting, gathering and synthesizing stuff. Does it make the game easier? Yes surely, but it's much less stressful than playing a videogame with tightass deadlines as if it were your day job.
While Atelier Sophie isn't quite the biggest technological advancement compared to the previous titles, I could argue very enjoyable to play. The game has only one ending and one missable achievement, so you don't really have to keep checking the internet for routes, managing saves and all the shit that comes with multiple endings and missable cheevos. Just sit back and enjoy some 'slice of life' game, with cute girls doing cute and funny things, and the shit us weebs all love.

소피의 아틀리에 : 신비한 책의 연금술사.
귀여운 등장인물이 있는 아니메 느낌의 일본게임.
재료를 모아 연금술로 여러 물품을 연성하며 이야기가 진행된다.
게임진행이 단순하며 캐릭터 외에는 그래픽이 좋다고 할 수 없다. 부족한 점도 많이 보인다.
AAA급 게임을 주로 하는 플레이어에게는 실망을 줄지도 모른다.

폭력적이고 잔인한 게임이 질린다면 플레이 해보기를 추천한다.
자막은 영어, 음성은 일어와 영어가 있다.
일어음성과 영어자막이면 해석이 쉽다. 한글이 없어도 플레이에 전혀 문제가 없으니 언어의 장벽에 좌절하지 말자.
조작에 대해서도 말이 많은데, 이 부분은 처음에 불편함을 느꼈다. 어느 키가 어느 버튼의 역할을 하는지 알아야하기 때문이다. 하지만 이 또한 시간이 지나면 문제가 되지 않는다.
단, 영일어 둘다 못 한다면 공부하거나 포기하라.

ps.개인적으로 삽화가 마음에 든다.

30181280.review:
Spoiler Free.

Atelier Sophie follows the day to day life of Sophie, as she strives to become a great alchemist.

Unlike what some people say, the game does have a main story and yes it is linear. No, the story isnt a great adventure round the world fighting great evils, but it's an adventure non the less. The story revolves around Sophie and her daily life, helping people in her city as well as her friends, while improving her knowledge of alchemy. This is also where the main story lies, as Sophie learns more and more about alchemy, she is able to craft different items, some of them, required for the main plot.

Sophie has companions who will join and fight along her when she goes out gathering materials or hunting for monsters required for her alchemy. There are sidequests Sophie can do by acepting jobs from the city people, some of them require particular items Sophie can craft with alchemy, while others require some good ol' monster hunting. There are also rumors you can pay for, which will unlock certain new areas, or cause a boss monster to appear, while others are information regarding rare alchemy materials Sophie can go gather.

The combat is turn based, you can have 4 characters at once while fighting and you control each of them. Each character has different skills and carrying capacity (Not everyone can carry every item type Sophie crafts with alchemy). Every consumable item can be crafted through alchemy, and adding different traits while creating them will produce varying results, from healing potions that can resurrect to bombs that always crit.

I absolutely recommend this game, I loved the character designs, Sophie is a sweet girl and I enjoyed seeing her grow throughout the story. The crafting system is fun and engrossing as there are tons of trait combinations while creating a single item.
If you ever played Legend of Mana back on the PS1, or any Mana Khemia game, you will most likely enjoy this game aswell.

30168859.review:
Cute Fantasy Slice of Life JRPG with heavy focus on crafting.

Among the Atelier games this entry feels somewhat mediocre and in my opinion the weakest since the original Rorona. The changes to crafting and fighting aren't clear improvements, many of the characters feel somewhat bland and the removal of the usual time limit isn't necessarily a good thing (managing time was something I enjoyed and gave a sense of purpose in an otherwise aimless game).

The PC port also suffers from some problems. Without third party fixes browsing menus cause noticable fps drops, 2D assets seem to be 720p only (PS4 version is clearly better looking) and a game controller is a must. 

If you own a PS3/PS4/Vita and haven't tried any Atelier games I recommend picking those up first (plus version where available), on PC however there aren't many alternatives so it still recieves a recommendation from me.

Just be aware that this isn't the best Atelier can offer.

30125969.review:
First of all I heavily recommend that you use a controller with this game, its not optimised for keyboards at all.

This is a traditional JRPG with a spin that you have to do a lot of collecting of items to create stuff in your atelier. One would expect that this would send grinding alarm bells off but for the most part this seems fine. 

Furthermore the port is very well done and the performance of the game works pretty fantastically, there are no crashes and I can easily hit 4k 60fps with a gtx1060.

the only issue is that there isnt a very large selection for the graphics, only AA, res and post processing. Oddly enough it looks a lot better then in the store page screen shots. 

Overall I think if you are a fan of JRPGs with their oddities then this is worth getting and its great that its only £25, several sites are selling it at under £20 which is fantastic.

that being said this isnt one of those drop everything and buy it sort of games so if you are on the fence its better to play it safe and wait for a sale. 

And yes this plays so so much better then its console variant.

30119773.review:
採集素材，解析成分，進而分解合成出新的物質，被喻為當代化學雛形的鍊金術是許多電玩遊戲常見的題材，其中不乏出現以鍊金術士為登場角色職業的作品。這次要介紹的角色扮演遊戲《Atelier Sophie: The Alchemist of the Mysterious Book》（以下簡稱《Atelier Sophie》）是由光榮特庫摩旗下子公司 Gust 二十年來長期經營研發《鍊金術士》系列之《不可思議》篇章序章作品，故事敘說一名叫做〝蘇菲〞的年輕鍊金術士，某日發現一本會擁有獨立思考能力且能與自己對話的奇妙書本，她發現取回書本主人〝普拉芙妲〞記憶的唯一方式是領悟出更多配方，並將它們寫進書內，於是蘇菲與好朋友們展開以助人為本的輕鬆愉快旅程，拯救世界甚麼的偉大理想只是路過順便處理的零碎瑣事。

《Atelier Sophie》是筆者首次接觸的《鍊金術士》系列作品，從他人口中聽聞是說《鍊金術士》系列通常會以三款遊戲作為一個篇章，所幸本作是《不可思議》篇章的首部曲，所以在劇情銜接上沒有任何問題。人物設定方面，作中登場人物幾乎全是（少部分除外）女主角蘇菲熟識的親朋好友，筆者第一眼看到新人物的反應通常是『先生你哪位？哪時候跟咱們那麼熟了？』，每次看到蘇菲一秒跟玩家從沒見過的人物裝熟會有股莫名其妙的違和感，剛開始還很擔心短短半小時內丟給玩家一堆新人物，要記住他們的個性或許會很困難，還好每一名人物登場時，背景都會響起專屬 BGM ，透過音樂和聲優語氣詮釋之下，對配角們產生的陌生感完全消失，不得不稱讚 Gust 在人設方面確實下足功夫。


鍊金系統是《Atelier Sophie》最大特色之一，遊戲內大多商店只會販賣素材，就算少數幾名商人偶爾會販賣裝備或補給品，效果也差強人意，我們必須發揮自給自足的精神，從野外採集如食用藥草、水晶礦石、動物毛皮等素材，接下來篩選適合用以分解合成的素材，絕大部分的素材都擁有【附加特性】（品質越好，特性越多），藥品可以依靠附加特性來追加使用次數、強化藥效、移除負面狀態等，裝備則能增強防禦、特化速度、以及提升品質。隨著遊戲進度發展，鍊金合成的配方會越來越多，倉庫內的素材也會呈現爆滿狀態，這時我們能夠前往小鎮內的咖啡廳跟老闆接洽委託，把非必要或低等素材作成委託所需的藥品或強化素材，不僅能解決倉庫爆滿問題，還能賺取金錢，可說是一舉兩得。


戰鬥系統部分中規中矩，採用傳統回合制戰鬥，玩家能指派包含蘇菲在內的四名角色戰鬥，速度數值會影響單一回合攻擊先後順序，若被持續攻擊到一定程度，該名對象將陷入 Break 狀態，除了一回合不能行動，所受傷害也會大幅提升；隨著進攻次數提升，畫面左下角會持續累積 Chain Link 計量表，200%、300%分別會出現兩人、三人合體技，威力強大的合體技是克敵致勝的關鍵。遊戲初期如果不熟悉鍊金系統，無法創造品質優異武器防具，建議大家蒐集火藥粉製作各屬性炸彈擊敗強敵，不過要注意的是，除非擁有鍊金術道具知識，否則藥品或食物以外的道具無法裝備在角色身上，簡單來說就是把危險物品全都往蘇菲身上塞，其他腦袋空空不懂得欣賞爆破藝術的傢伙通通帶著熱牛奶和三明治野餐吧！

最令人失望的就屬角色培育系統，本作登場人物雖多，但仍脫離不了坦補打鐵三角概念，數值高低直接取代人物特性，加上各角色習得主動技能最多就四種，最稀少的又是輔助技能（補血技能超缺，是在鼓勵大家多吃藥嗎？），導致遊戲後期只要提煉出好的素材，給商人代工打造出優秀武器防具，練到 20 等之後再次升級贈與的冒險者點數放著不用也沒差（冒險者點數主要用以解鎖人物特性以及提升基礎數值）。遇到打不過的強大敵人？沒關係！花點時間到處採集素材，合成出全數值大幅提升特性，製作裝備並花大筆金錢強化到最高階級，就算是手無縛雞之力的蘇菲也能舉起玩具法杖平砍虐爆最終頭目。


相較於動不動就在拯救世界，或是防止宇宙次元被破壞的角色扮演遊戲，《Atelier Sophie》是款無壓力的養老遊戲，跟隨同伴出遊挖掘素材，好不容易蒐集到珍貴稀有素材，合成出近乎完美的道具，心裡藏不住的成就感油然而生，就算前幾個小時的所作所為對主線劇情毫無幫助，還是玩得非常開心。筆者最初以為過於薄弱的主線劇情會成為拖垮評價的絆腳石，直到體驗數名角色支線任務才發現『本作精髓之處在於用心扮演蘇菲這一號人物，過著看似奇妙實際上卻很平凡的日常生活。』，或許這款遊戲是專門為厭倦每次都被要求身負重任，實際上僅想靜下心來好好紓解壓力的玩家所設計。順帶一提，本作優化依然十分糟糕，尤其是在進入練金介面時， CPU 使用率會突破天際，已經傳出不少災情。


優點：
+鍊金系統易懂難精，如何同時兼具高品質與良好特性，成為主要追求項目。
+人物設定優秀，個性鮮明結合專屬背景故事，很難討厭作中任何一名角色。
+主線故事可放著不管，無時間限制愛玩多久就玩多久，無憂無慮逍遙自在。



缺點：
-優化效能不忍直視，進入鍊金介面 CPU 使用率瞬間飆高，每秒幀數明顯下降。
-角色培育系統過於陽春，導致裝備大於一切培育，不靠好裝備很難擊敗強敵。


結論：如果不介意優化太差外加繁中語系被拔掉，這是款值得一玩的優秀佳作。


網誌圖文好讀版：
http://mgrim214.blogspot.com/2017/02/atelier-sophie-alchemist-of-mysterious.html

[b]Story[/b]
The story is kinda simple, Sophie is a newbie alchemist who want to get better at alchemy to make people in her hometown (Kirchen bell) happy. in the beginning of the game, Sophie meet Plachta who is a talking and flying book also she is expert in alchemy, unfortunately Plachta doesnt remember a thing about her past, so Sophie help Plachta to regain her memories by writing recipes in her book (get it Plachta is a book)[spoiler]rly bad pun sry[/spoiler] and Plachta will teach Sophie alchemy to become a better alchemist

[b]Port[/b]
Decent port actually, i didn't have any issues while playing this games, no crashes whatsoever (maybe iam lucky ?) the launcher only have 3 Settings, Anti Aliasing, Shadow Quality, and Resolution (Up to 3840x2160), No borderless sadly, if you using keyboard, you will having a hardtime, so play this game with Xbox 360 controller or PS4 Controller.

[b]Pros[/b] :[list][*]Depth alchemy system.
[*]Day & Night cycle. you will get different monster depending in morning or night.
[*]So many items to make.
[*]If you play this game in really hard difficulty (Despair) it will reward you with better items and more exp.
[*]Rumors system. if you buy rumors, you will get material with rare traits or rare monster to gather/hunt.
[*]Friendship points. If your friendship points is high enough, you will get extra cutscenes and new traits for them.
[*]Soooo many traits to make OverPower Items and Weapons.
[*]The soundtrack is so good especially the final boss.
[*]3D models is detailed for each character.
[/list]

[b]Cons[/b] :[list]
[*]2d Sprites is 720p (PS3 Version).
[*]Very low fps in menu. (there is a fix in the steam forum, go look for it)
[*]only 2 (3 with DLC) costume for sophie.
[*]No keyboard support (like changing the keybind).
[/list]       
i think thats it, thanks for reading

30079040.review:
Si eres fanatico del Jrpg te va a gustar el regreso de la serie Atelier al PC, es el mismo juego de PS 4 que ya salio hace mas de un año. El juego en si no es un juego que revolucione ni aporte nada nuevo al genero, con graficos sencillos  y personajes detallados, muy al nivel de la serie "tales of" De Namco. En jugabilidad destaca por peleas cortas y sencillas sin grandes desafios al menos hasta la ultima parte del juego. Si, en cambio, es muy adictivo el sistema de crafteo de este juego, bastante. Podras craftear absolutamente todos los items del juego, curativos, equipos, armas, materiales, etc. Y customizarlos hasta que obtengas los atributos deseados, y es en este punto el que juego se vuelve entrenido, recolectar materiales una y otra vez se puede hacer monotono pero la sensacion de logro a travez de la experimentacion es un incentivo. Una historia sencilla con personajes variados pero algo corta. Se extrañan dungeons mas largos para explorar pero la mecanica del juego obliga a que sean reducidos, probablemente para no hacer demasiado fastidiosa la recoleccion. En el aspecto sonoro cabe destacar la banda sonora del juego, con excelentes melodias y un gran cast de voces, al menos en la version en ingles que fue el idioma en que lo jugue.

En fin, lo recomiendo solo si eres fan de la saga o el jrpg en general. Es un buen regreso para la saga de Gust, y una buena introduccion de cara a Atelier Firis que se estrena este marzo/2017 en simultaneo con las consolas.
